p: High mobility group protein B1 (HMGB1) is a non-histone chromatin-binding protein, and a highly phosphorylated protein. HMGB1 is involved in gene transcription and DNA replication, repair and recombination by assembling and stabilizing the nucleosomes and binding to transcription factors [ 28]. Recently, HMGB1 has been found to mediate the lethal systemic inflammatory response. Studies have shown that inflammatory cytokines TNF-α or IL-1 can stimulate monocyte-macrophages to release HMGB1, which reversely stimulates the secretion of inflammatory cytokines and induces the chemotaxis of neutrophils. HMGB1 also plays an important role in the development of anti-virus vaccines [ 29]. Ricin poisoning can induce systemic inflammatory response, leading to inflammatory cytokines “storm”. The expression level of HMGB1 significantly increased in the experimental group, which might be the direct result of this inflammatory response.
